review_blob: 75cl bottle pours with a huge white head and pale body. Very lovely hoppy aroma with lots of passion fruit and some herbal notes. Taste is like the nose and very crisp and dry + bitter at the end. Great every day drinking hoppy beer. Bravo!
33cl bottle. Orange with small head. Lovely aromas of pine and very orange fruity. Flavor is rich and fruity and bitter to the end. Very good well done!

Waaaaouuu!! Tasted last week end on tap at lExpress de Lyon (Paris)
An amazing nose and very unusual. Very tropical, mangoes and passion fruit on a dark wheat beer.
On the palate, nice and creamy, very fruity again with a hint of dark chocolate.
Very pleasant and long finish, I want another one! There you go, Im a big fan now!

Very nice beer for the hops geeks. Appearance a little bit cloudy but very citrucy on the nose. On the mouth good texture, a bit dry (maybe dry yeast) and very refreshing bitterness. Definetely a french beer to taste!

Nice beer tasted on a beer festival in France. Appearance a liitle bit to cloudy but good complexity on the nose. Nicely hopped and very refreshing.
Well balanced bitterness.

Great IPA, Floral, good complexity and very pleasant bitterness.
Got it from Les Fleurs du Malt, Lyon, France

Very pale coloured beer with a delicious sharp fruity nose. Almost no head and little carbonation like a cask beer. The taste is citric fruity and so refreshing and easy to drink. Another great beer from Thornbridge and makes me think of a good British pub!

In a Londin pub strange to ask for a pint of Doom! Red brown beer wih classic English signature - subtle hops, a bit of fruit and buiscity malt. I heard good things about this beer and was not really impressed..

Pale, yellow beer with very small head. Beautiful nose of tropical fruit and dry, winey notes. Very fuity palate with the bitterness growing and long-lasting. Low carbonation reminds me of cask beer in a pub. Great beer.
Unattractive pale beer with poor head that falls to quick. Vinegar aroma and acidic, infected taste. This is terribe. What shame to sell this.

Beer exploded out of bottle and all over the table (typical for this brewery.) The beer is dark but we can see it is all mixed up with big bits of yeast and looks terrible. The flavour is thin and... yeasty. Really dissapointing - I poured it away.
beer_name: Au Baron Saison Saint Mdard Cuve De Nol

review_blob: More black than tawny. Head falls quickly. Aroma of roasty coffee but dirty notes. Taste the same - very roasty but lots of dead yeast is not good.
Lovely farm aroma like Saison Dupont. The palate is sofer and less acidic than Dupont. After a few minutes the head has gone completely and the taste has become more sickly.

Lovely nose with exotic fruits from the hops. The palate is dissapointing - very bitter and to rich. I dont see the point in these beers that are so unbalanced they are not drinkable - must be a male competition thing.
Pale golden beer with nose of resinous hops. Quite sharp and lemony in the mouth. Woody hops. Not bad but I was expecting more.
on cask: nice and clear golden beer with a white head. Quite hoppy and aromatic on the nose and pleasant bitterness in the finish. Medium bodied.

Lovely cherry colour with a nice creamy head. Nice fruity nose with a hint of casks flavours. Dont usually like fruity beers but this one was appreciated in the middle of the afternoon with the sunshine.
Liked the dry and long finish.

Attractive golden coloured beer with such a great aroma - spicy and lemony and peppery. The taste is a delicate mix of fruitiness, spices and malt. Warming alcohol. Very dry finish - I love this beer as an aperitif.

Lager like in appearnece. Not very good nose - bad things. The taste is also bad with acidity and sulphurous waste. 
I give up on trying finding an organic beer that is not just marketing.
Golden as expected. Malty aroma and very slightly fruity. Taste is pretty poor with little to say - a bit malty and a bit fruity. Another disapointing organic beer.
Lovely looking beer with enormous head. Apples, farmyard and hay in the nose. Fruity and hoppy palate with sour finish. Great beer with food.

Copper red colour. Aroma reminds me of oak barrels - spicy and pain grill. Flavour is amazingly complex with cherries and other red fruits before a long, tart finish. This is between beer and wine. So good and great with food (I tried with lamb.) I could drink this every day!
Lovely aroma of coffee right away. The taste is dark, bitter chocolate and liquorice, with a creamy full texture. Amazing beer to try with some chocolate dessets!
Keg. Hazy golden ale with beautiful hoppy nose. So fruity from the Cascade hops - lemon and lime and grapefruit. Bitterness is powerful and sharp but not too much. Dry finish. Great beer!!
Already in the bottle it looks like there is 1cm of yeast. Beer pours very cloudy with small head. Aroma is dirty and flavour is sour and unpleasant. What a shame.
Served from a cask. Orange coloured ale with a small head. Aroma slightly malty and slightly hoppy. Taste the same as aroma. A bit watery.
Poured with small head. Not much aroma. Flavour quite neutral and not like a wheat beer. Bad taste left behind. Not good at all.
Poured with a big head. Aroma is welcoming with fruitiness and roasted grain. Flavous is strange with bitter orange - like eating orange peel. Unusual and not great.
Great dark Trappist. Complex spicy and dark fruity nose. Flavour is so rich with dates and figs in alcohol and spicy notes. Texture is also rich and long dark finish.
On keg. Amazing beer!!! Lovely creamy head, slightly hazy. Citrus notes - orange peels - and cloves. Very complex and good structure.
Bottle. Pale yellow with small head. Hoppy but not too obvious. Flavour is slighly citrus and wee-balances malt and hops. A bit dirty in the aftertaste.
Yellow hazy and poor mousse. Thin body and light malty flavour. Nothing special.
Deep chestnut colour. Nutty and fruity - dried raisins and spicy also. Very pleasant winter beer.
This is a nice beer. Nice creamy head with good persistence. Tropical fruits and citrus fruits on the nose and palate. Long pleasantly bitter finish. Ill buy it again.

Tasted it in a londonian pub. Typical british style of beer. Refreshing but not a lot of body to my taste. Nice hoppy flavour, hay, little fruity. Quite dry. Not to bad. Considering that british people drink huge quantities, it has to be thin.

Very hazy pale gold colour. The head didnt last very long and gave an infected beer type of appearance. Nose: farmyard and apples. Not really complex for a Grand Cru. Good packaging though but not really impressed...Ill give it another try if I have the opportunity...

Ive discovered this beer 6 years ago and its always been a pleasure to drink it since. Lovely dark colour with nice coffee head. On the nose: dark chocolate, dark fruits and arabica. On the palate: lovely texture, quite deep and long finish. Good complexity. Nice beer to drink on a winter night by the fire.

beer_brewer_name: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review_blob: The first dark wheat beer I tasted. Probably one of my favourite beers ever. Amazinc complexity - bananas, spices (cinnamon, cloves), fruits - great length. A good after-deinner beer. Highly recommended.
Bottle from beer shop in Paris. Pretty bland and where are the chestnuts? Another boring beer.

Tried in a tiny, dirty pub in London - I forget the name. 
Very poor for an IPA. Almost completely flat and a dirty nose. Not very hoppy. I wonder if this beer would survive going to France, forget India!
Very appley and citrus nose. Flavour is very Orval-like with a good acidity and farmhouse notes. Very refreshing and good length. Good French beer!
Tasted at the Bow Bar in Edimburgh. Blonde coloured beer with lovely fruity and floral hoppy nose. The taste is also hoppy with good fruitiness. Excellent cask beer.

Found it in a beer shop in Paris. Lovely golden colour beer. Between blond and amber. Good lasting head. Good fruitiness on the nose with hop flowers.
On the palate, pleasantly dry with a well balanced bitterness. Probably Cascade hops. Lots of fruits like grape fruits, lemons and pineapple. Also a hint of bergamot. Great complexity and very good length. At last a good beer in France, Ill get a case tomorrow.
Got it during a trip to Scotland. Pretty poor beer. Pretty bland and pretty similar to a beer youll find in the supermarket. Not much to say....
Nice refreshing beer. Pleasant level of hoppiness. Well Balanced beer, when well we be able to find it in France???

Really nice wheat beer with tropical fruits flavours on the nose and palate. Great complexity ripe apples and passion fruit!
A shame he cant produce a lot! If you have the chance to find one, get it!

Nice red berries on the nose.I was expecting a bit more complexity. Good length and quite a lot of residual sugars.
Not bad but not great.
beer_name: Struise Pannept - Old Monks Ale - Pannepeut

review_blob: Nice dark colour with pretty head. On the nose: malty, slightly chocolaty but no complexity. On the palate, Im sorry but I couldnt even swallow this. Infected and vinegar like......to resume I couldnt even cook with it....went in the sink!

Hazy appearance with light gold colour.
The first nose reminded me of a lightly oaky chardonnay. I closed my eyes and thought of Burgundy. Very good complexity on the nose probably due to great yeast. A few citrus notes on the palate. Good cleansing acidity. A great beer to taste, want another one now...

Im very sorry but I had this beer a few months ago and this was pretty much an amateur beer.
There wasnt much complexity on the nose and palate and a short length.
It was drinkable...just.
Look forward to tasting proper beer now...
